page.title: 13IN THE NEWS ON WHALSAY
page.content: People on Whalsay have been talking about a number of things that concern them.One of them is the school.The present one is far too small,there are not enough rooms for all the pupils. There have been temporary buildings outside the school for 15 years.The school is an old building,it was built as the Laird's Hall,and cannot just be altered in just any way.It might be that a complete new school may be built instead.It is hoped to include a sports centre and swimming pool in the extension or new school. Also cause for concern is the fact that old people in need of care at present have to go to Lerwick.They would much prefer to stay on Whalsay and people have been speaking about getting an old folks home built on the isle.There has already been an offer of land at Marrister.
